Description: Icelandic people are referred to by their first names on second mention eg the former prime minister Jóhanna Sigurðardóttir, then Jóhanna thereafter. This is because last names are typically patronymic, indicating the person is the son or daughter of the father, and are not, like most western last names, an indication of family lineage eg Jóhanna Sigurðardóttir is Jóhanna, the daughter (dóttir) of Sigurðar Egill Ingimundarson. There are occasional exceptions to this so it is always worth checking.
